elements.title: St. Bernward (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that St. Bernward (pictured) in Döhren was consecrated in 1893, when part of Christoph Hehl's design of a basilica in the Romanesque Revival style was built, but the building was only completed after World War II?

elements.title: a proposed state constitutional amendment (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that because of a mistake in a proposed state constitutional amendment, the New Jersey Legislature defined biannually to mean biennially?

elements.title: Robert de Ogle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Robert de Ogle captured five Scottish knights near Newcastle in 1341 and received royal licence to crenellate his property?

elements.title: National Wrestling Conference (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the National Wrestling Conference's controversial KKK storyline was the inspiration for an episode of the Netflix series GLOW?

elements.title: 2022 UK Championship (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Gary Wilson threw his cue stick to the floor in anger at the 2022 UK Championship?

elements.title: Margaret F. Butler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1908, American otorhinolaryngologist Margaret F. Butler became the first woman to preside over an international congress of physicians?

elements.title: Black Speech (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that it was J. R. R. Tolkien's intention for Black Speech to be "full of harsh and hideous sounds and vile words"?

elements.title: Ella Stewart Udall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ella Stewart Udall relayed her husband's letters to his semi-secret second wife?
